Package zujkomiller.genetic

This package contains the core classes involved in performing genetic algorithms: the controlling class (Evolver), an abstract class defining GenerationProducers, and interfaces for Chromosome and FitnessTester.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
Chromosome A Chromosome is a list of genes represented by an array of short values.
EvolutionObservable Classes implementing EvolutionObserver may register themselves with classes which implement this interface, EvolutionObservable, so that they will be notified when new generations are created and tested for fitness.
EvolutionObserver Classes implementing this interface, EvolutionObserver, may register themselves with classes which implement EvolutionObservable so that they will be notified when new generations are created and tested for fitness.
FitnessTester Any class implementing this interface should be able to judge a Chromosome for fitness and return an int indicating the fitness score.
 

Class Summary
Evolver Evolver controls the execution of the genetic algorithm.
Generation A Generation is an array of Chromosomes and includes an int indicating this generation's number as well as the top score achieved by any individual Chromosome in this generation.
GenerationProducer Subclasses of GenerationProducer are responsible for creating an initial population of Chromosomes, and then for creating a child Generation from a parent Generation by replicating the best individuals from the parent, dropping the worst individuals, performing crossovers, and performing mutations.
ProducerFactory The ProducerFactory is used to create a subclass of GenerationProducer which is appropriate for the type of genetic algorithm the user wishes to employ.
 

Package zujkomiller.genetic Description

This package contains the core classes involved in performing genetic algorithms: the controlling class (Evolver), an abstract class defining GenerationProducers, and interfaces for Chromosome and FitnessTester.
